intro: Isotrema brevilimbum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved isotrema, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and produces yellowish-green flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its structure includes a woody stem with simple, alternate leaves. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, smooth seeds.
